answers.answer: I had my son at 37 but was actually 36 when I got pg.  I'm still 37 and we are trying for number two.  We were seeing a fertility specialists when I pg with my son and we are seeing the same dr again.I would seek medical guidance from a dr.  37 is considered advanced maternal age so you really don't know how much time you have left.best of luck to you.

I had my year old baby at age 37 and am trying for another now.I turned 38 in June but I have always been very fertile so hopefully it wont take too long. Although my last baby DID take a lot longer to get pregnant with than my first 6.The rule of thumb is, if after trying for 6 months it hasn't happened, then you want to see a specialist.

I had my first baby when I was well past age 37.  While it is much harder to GET pregnant at 37, it is not necessarily any more risky to be pregnant.  The ease of pregnancy depends a lot more on your health than it does on your age.  If you are in excellent health, getting enough to eat in a good balance of categories (a lot of protein, some carbs, not too much candy, etc.) and getting your prenatal vitamins, and if you exercise, and are not overweight or underweight, and have no medical condition such as diabetes that makes pregnancy more difficult, there is no reason age 37 means that you will have trouble carrying a child to term.As for your second question, a man's sperm will die pretty fast if exposed to air.  But if you have sex and the man's sperm is inside you, it is said it can last 4 days (or even 5, some studies suggest).
